p 
<p>William James "Bill" Murray (born September 21, 1950) is an American actor and comedian. He first gained exposure on Saturday Night Live for which he earned an Emmy Award and later went on to star in comedy films, including Meatballs (1979), Caddyshack (1980), Ghostbusters (1984), What About Bob? (1991), and Groundhog Day (1993).</p>
<p>Murray garnered additional critical acclaim later in his career, starring in Lost in Translation (2003), which earned him an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor, the indie comedy-drama Broken Flowers (2005) and a series of films directed by Wes Anderson, including Rushmore (1998), The Royal Tenenbaums (2001), The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (2004), The Darjeeling Limited (2007), Fantastic Mr. Fox (2009), Moonrise Kingdom (2012), and The Grand Budapest Hotel (2014).</p>
<p>Murray was born and raised in Wilmette, Illinois, a northern suburb of Chicago. He is the son of Lucille (née Collins), a mail room clerk, and Edward Joseph Murray II, a lumber salesman. Murray and his eight siblings were raised in a Catholic Irish American family. Their father died in 1967 from complications of diabetes, when Bill was 17 years old.</p>

William James "Bill" Murray (born September 21, 1950) is an American actor and comedian. He first gained exposure on Saturday Night Live for which he earned an Emmy Award and later went on to star in comedy films, including Meatballs (1979), Caddyshack (1980), Ghostbusters (1984), What About Bob? (1991), and Groundhog Day (1993).

Murray garnered additional critical acclaim later in his career, starring in Lost in Translation (2003), which earned him an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor, the indie comedy-drama Broken Flowers (2005) and a series of films directed by Wes Anderson, including Rushmore (1998), The Royal Tenenbaums (2001), The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (2004), The Darjeeling Limited (2007), Fantastic Mr. Fox (2009), Moonrise Kingdom (2012), and The Grand Budapest Hotel (2014).

Murray was born and raised in Wilmette, Illinois, a northern suburb of Chicago. He is the son of Lucille (née Collins), a mail room clerk, and Edward Joseph Murray II, a lumber salesman. Murray and his eight siblings were raised in a Catholic Irish American family. Their father died in 1967 from complications of diabetes, when Bill was 17 years old.

<div class="hatnote">
	Main article: <a href="#" title="Bill Murray Filmography">Bill Murray Filmography</a>
</div>
Main article: Bill Murray Filmography
blockquote 
<blockquote cite="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_Smith">
	<p>I don't like it when people come up to me after my plays and say, "I really dug your message, man." Or, "I really dug your play, man, I cried." You know. I like it when people come up to me the next day, or a week later, and they say, "I saw your play. What happened?</p>
	<cite><span class="person">Bill Murray</span>, <span class="profession">Actor</span></cite>
</blockquote>

I don't like it when people come up to me after my plays and say, "I really dug your message, man." Or, "I really dug your play, man, I cried." You know. I like it when people come up to me the next day, or a week later, and they say, "I saw your play. What happened?

Bill Murray, Actor

	<li><code>}</code></li>
</ol>

  2. margin-bottom: 10px;
  3. font-size: 18px;
  4. font-weight: bold;
  5. }
kbd 
<p>To take a screenshot on your Mac, press <kbd>⌘ Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>⇧ Shift</kbd> + <kbd>3</kbd>.</p>

To take a screenshot on your Mac, press ⌘ Cmd + ⇧ Shift + 3.

Schema

Schema: Organization & Postal Address 
<div class="address">
	<div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization">
		<span itemprop="name">Company Name</span><br>
		<span itemprop="address" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">
			<span itemprop="streetAddress">99 London Road</span><br>
			<span itemprop="addressLocality">Kensington</span><br>
			<span itemprop="addressRegion">London</span><br>
			<span itemprop="postalCode">TE5 7ER</span><br>
			<span itemprop="addressCountry">UK</span>
		</span>
	</div>
</div>

Kensington

Buttons & CTA's

All CTA's should have an initial .btn class. There are predefined Call to Action buttons in the _buttons.scss partial to abstract the default .btn class. These are defined as .standard, .positive and .negative. Alternatively you can create a CTA from any of the colours in the colour swatch array simply by using the colour name instead. For example .btn .orange will create a button with the orange background colour from the swatch.

Standard linked CTA's 
<a href="#" class="btn standard">CTA Standard</a>
<a href="#" class="btn positive">CTA Positive</a>
<a href="#" class="btn negative">CTA Negative</a>
CTA Standard CTA Positive CTA Negative
Disabled CTA's 
<a href="#" class="btn standard disabled">CTA Standard</a>
<a href="#" class="btn positive disabled">CTA Positive</a>
<a href="#" class="btn negative disabled">CTA Negative</a>
CTA Standard CTA Positive CTA Negative
JavaScript CTA's (Buttons) 
<button class="btn standard">CTA Standard</button>
<button class="btn positive">CTA Positive</button>
<button class="btn negative">CTA Negative</button>
Coloured CTA's from Swatch 
<button class="btn red">CTA Red</button>
<button class="btn orange">CTA Orange</button>
<button class="btn blue">CTA Blue</button>

Lists

ul 
<ul>
	<li>List item 1</li>
	<li>List item 2
		<ul>
			<li>Sub list item 1</li>
			<li>Sub list item 2</li>
			<li>Sub list item 3</li>
		</ul>
	</li>
	<li>List item 3</li>
	<li>List item 4</li>
</ul>
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
    • Sub list item 1
    • Sub list item 2
    • Sub list item 3
  • List item 3
  • List item 4
ol 
<ol>
	<li>List item 1</li>
	<li>List item 2
		<ol>
			<li>Sub list item 1</li>
			<li>Sub list item 2</li>
			<li>Sub list item 3</li>
		</ol>
	</li>
	<li>List item 3</li>
	<li>List item 4</li>
</ol>
  1. List item 1
  2. List item 2
    1. Sub list item 1
    2. Sub list item 2
    3. Sub list item 3
  3. List item 3
  4. List item 4
dl 
<dl>
	<dt>First term.</dt>
	<dd>Definition of the above term.</dd>
	<dt>Second term.</dt>
	<dd>Definition of the above term.</dd>
	<dt>Third term.</dt>
	<dd>Definition of the above term.</dd>
</dl>
First term.
Definition of the above term.
Second term.
Definition of the above term.
Third term.
Definition of the above term.

Pagination 
<div class="pagination">
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers prev">« Prev</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers">1</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers current">2</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers">3</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers">4</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers">5</a>
	<a href="#" class="page-numbers next">Next »</a>
</div>
« Prev 1 2 3 4 5 Next »

Breadcrumb

Breadcrumb 
<div class="breadcrumb" itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a href="/" title="Home" itemprop="url"><span itemprop="title">Home</span></a>
	<span>»</span>
	<span itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
		<a href="#" title="Link title" itemprop="url"><span itemprop="title">Page Title</span></a>
	</span>
	<span>»</span>
	<span itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
		<a href="#" title="Link title" itemprop="url"><span itemprop="title">Page Title</span></a>
	</span>
	<span>»</span>
	<span itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
		<span itemprop="title">Page Title</span>
	</span>
</div>
Home » Page Title » Page Title » Page Title

Forms

Please view the additional forms styleguide for a complete form usage example and see all the various abstractions. The forms styleguide also invokes the built in jQuery form validation script and has a PHP mailer example.

label 
<label for="field_id">Field Name</label>
<label for="field_id">Field Name (Required) <abbr>*</abbr></label>
<div class="label">Field Name</div>
<div class="label">Field Name (Required) <abbr>*</abbr></div>
Field Name (via Class)
Field Name (via Class) (Required) *
input[type="text"] 
<input type="text">
<span class="note">A note about this field.</span>
A note about this field.
input[type="text"] readonly 
<input type="text" value="Field value" readonly>
<span class="note">A note about this field.</span>
A note about this field.
input[type="text"] disabled 
<input type="text" value="Field value" disabled>
<span class="note">A note about this field.</span>
A note about this field.
select 
<select>
	<option value="">Please Select</option>
	<option value="Option #1">Option #1</option>
	<option value="Option #2">Option #2</option>
	<option value="Option #3">Option #3</option>
</select>

button 
<button type="submit">Submit Button</button>
<button type="submit" disabled>Disabled Button</button>
<button type="reset">Reset Button</button>

Grids

Grids are fully responsive and you can use any combination consecutively without splitting into rows. To initiate a grid just requires a wrapping element with the a class of .grid. Direct descendants of the Grid element should be classed by the required column width. For example a descendant with .col-1-2 will create a half length column. You can add any type of column width to complete the grid in any format you wish.

Responsive Grid 
<div class="grid">
	<div class="col-1-4">
		<div class="module">
			.col-1-4
		</div>
	</div>

Sliders / Carousels

Sliders are provided by the excellent BX Slider. These are basic examples and not predefined in the Framework. View the BX Slider Options to learn more about the extensive API.

Full Width Slider 
<div class="slider-container">
	<div class="slider">
		<div class="slider__slide">
			<img src="http://fillmurray.com/400/150" alt="Placeholder">
		</div>
		<div class="slider__slide">
			<img src="http://fillmurray.com/400/150" alt="Placeholder">
		</div>
		<div class="slider__slide">

Accordions

Standard Accordion 
<div class="accordion" role="tablist" multiselectable="true">
	<div class="accordion__title" role="tablist">
		<button aria-selected="true" aria-expanded="false"><span class="more"></span> Accordion Title #1</button>
	</div>
	<div class="accordion__content" role="tabpanel" aria-hidden="true">
		Accordion Content
	</div>
	<div class="accordion__title" role="tablist">
		<button aria-selected="true" aria-expanded="false"><span class="more"></span> Accordion Title #2</button>
	</div>
	<div class="accordion__content" role="tabpanel" aria-hidden="true">
		Accordion Content
	</div>
	<div class="accordion__title" role="tablist">
		<button aria-selected="true" aria-expanded="false"><span class="more"></span> Accordion Title #3</button>
	</div>
	<div class="accordion__content" role="tabpanel" aria-hidden="true">
		Accordion Content
	</div>
</div>
Accordion Content
Accordion Content
Accordion Content

Tabs

Natural Tabs 
<div class="tabs">
	<ul class="tabs__nav" role="tablist">
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_1" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_1" aria-selected="false">Tab #1</button>
		</li>
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_2" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_2" aria-selected="false">Tab #2</button>
		</li>
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_3" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_3" aria-selected="false">Tab #3</button>
		</li>
	</ul>
	<div class="tabs__system">
		<div id="tab_id_1" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_1" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 1 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
		<div id="tab_id_2" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_2" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 2 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
		<div id="tab_id_3" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_3" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 3 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

Tab 1 content goes here.

Tab 2 content goes here.

Tab 3 content goes here.

Full Width Tabs 
<div class="tabs tabs-full-width">
	<ul class="tabs__nav" role="tablist">
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_1" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_1" aria-selected="false">Tab #1</button>
		</li>
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_2" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_2" aria-selected="false">Tab #2</button>
		</li>
		<li role="presentation">
			<button data-tab-target="tab_id_3" role="tab" aria-controls="tab_id_3" aria-selected="false">Tab #3</button>
		</li>
	</ul>
	<div class="tabs__system">
		<div id="tab_id_1" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_1" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 1 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
		<div id="tab_id_2" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_2" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 2 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
		<div id="tab_id_3" class="tabs__tab" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab_id_3" aria-hidden="true">
			<p>Tab 3 content goes here.</p>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
